learning_outcomes.description: Apply frontier knowledge to solve complex, real-world problems.
Critically interpret and independently evaluate issues to deliver innovative and effective solutions.
Conduct themselves in an ethical and socially responsible way by adopting forward-looking solutions to support a more sustainable economy.

assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Tutorial/ Problem Set
assessments.task_description:
Analytical and data-based problems.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment must be submitted by the due date and time as stated in the course profile. For this course, students are required to submit via Turnitin on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
11/05/2026 2:00 pm

Exam will take place during lecture on Monday 11 May.
assessments.task_description: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Replication and extension of an analytical and data-based journal paper. This assignment includes a short video presentation.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment must be submitted by the due date and time as stated in the course profile. For this course, students are required to submit via Turnitin on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Introduction and Math Review

Course introduction; review of elementary probability and statistics; review of basic linear algebra.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Introduction and Math Review Course introduction; review of elementary probability and statistics; review of basic linear algebra.

learning_activities.topic:
Review of Ordinary Least Squares Estimation

Review matrix treatment of linear conditional mean modeling; OLS estimator; Gauss-Markov Theorem and assumptions; conditional prediction; loss function.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Review of Ordinary Least Squares Estimation Review matrix treatment of linear conditional mean modeling; OLS estimator; Gauss-Markov Theorem and assumptions; conditional prediction; loss function.

learning_activities.topic:
Regression Modeling and M-Estimation

From statistical to econometric models; conditional quantiles (CQ); semiparametric models; M-estimation.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Regression Modeling and M-Estimation From statistical to econometric models; conditional quantiles (CQ); semiparametric models; M-estimation.

learning_activities.topic:
The Likelihood Function and Maximum Likelihood Estimation

Basic likelihood concepts; score functions; computation of MLE; asymptotic properties; examples from univariate and regression models.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_title: The Likelihood Function and Maximum Likelihood Estimation
learning_activities.topic_description: The Likelihood Function and Maximum Likelihood Estimation Basic likelihood concepts; score functions; computation of MLE; asymptotic properties; examples from univariate and regression models.

learning_activities.topic:
The Bayesian Framework

Quantifying uncertainty about parameters with probabilities defined on random variables; specifying prior distributions; computing posterior distributions from priors updated by the likelihood; examples from univariate and regression models.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: The Bayesian Framework Quantifying uncertainty about parameters with probabilities defined on random variables; specifying prior distributions; computing posterior distributions from priors updated by the likelihood; examples from univariate and regression models.

learning_activities.topic:
Parameter Identification and Instrumental Variable Estimation

Simultaneous equations modelling; the Analogy Principle; causal parameters; IV estimation; GMM estimation.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Parameter Identification and Instrumental Variable Estimation Simultaneous equations modelling; the Analogy Principle; causal parameters; IV estimation; GMM estimation.

learning_activities.topic:
Catchup Week and Commencing the Replication Paper (No in-person lecture or tutorial)

This week is allocated to students catching up on Week 1-6 material as well as to get started on the Replication Paper assignment.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_title: Catchup Week and Commencing the Replication Paper (No in-person lecture or tutorial)
learning_activities.topic_description: Catchup Week and Commencing the Replication Paper (No in-person lecture or tutorial) This week is allocated to students catching up on Week 1-6 material as well as to get started on the Replication Paper assignment.

learning_activities.topic:
Inference from Data: Hypothesis Testing and Full Posterior Analysis

Part I (online content): Review of inference based on sampling distributions; key concepts related to hypothesis testing.

Part II (lecture coverage): Fundamentals of inference from the posterior distribution; posterior quantiles, highest posterior density intervals; Bayes factors and Bayesian hypothesis testing; connection to sampling distributions, confidence intervals and hypothesis testing.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_title: Inference from Data: Hypothesis Testing and Full Posterior Analysis
learning_activities.topic_description: Inference from Data: Hypothesis Testing and Full Posterior Analysis Part I (online content): Review of inference based on sampling distributions; key concepts related to hypothesis testing. Part II (lecture coverage): Fundamentals of inference from the posterior distribution; posterior quantiles, highest posterior density intervals; Bayes factors and Bayesian hypothesis testing; connection to sampling distributions, confidence intervals and hypothesis testing.

learning_activities.topic:
Time-series Models

Introduction to stochastic processes; forecasting; dynamic effects; key theoretical and empirical challenges when observations are dependent; examples in applied macroeconomics.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Time-series Models Introduction to stochastic processes; forecasting; dynamic effects; key theoretical and empirical challenges when observations are dependent; examples in applied macroeconomics.

learning_activities.topic:
Labour Day public holiday (No Lecture or Tutorial)

Learning outcomes: L03
learning_activities.topic_title: Labour Day public holiday (No Lecture or Tutorial)
learning_activities.topic_description: Labour Day public holiday (No Lecture or Tutorial)

learning_activities.topic:
In-Semester Exam

The In-Semester Exam will be held on this day during lecture.
learning_activities.topic_description: In-Semester Exam The In-Semester Exam will be held on this day during lecture.

learning_activities.topic:
Panel Models

Basics of linear panel models; pooled, random effects and fixed effect models; types of exogeneity and endogenous regressors; GLS and GMM estimation methods; application to MABEL data.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Panel Models Basics of linear panel models; pooled, random effects and fixed effect models; types of exogeneity and endogenous regressors; GLS and GMM estimation methods; application to MABEL data.

learning_activities.topic:
High-Dimensional Models and Machine Learning

High dimensional regression modelling; Ridge regression; LASSO; penalty variable selection; Bayesian LASSO; double/debiased machine learning.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: High-Dimensional Models and Machine Learning High dimensional regression modelling; Ridge regression; LASSO; penalty variable selection; Bayesian LASSO; double/debiased machine learning.
